servinfo.title: Fail-Safe Table

attention3.ptxt: For identification of each cylinder and bank, refer to Precaution for Identification of Cylinder and Bank:N32A .

servinfo.ptxt: When any of the following DTCs is detected, ECM enters fail-safe mode as long as malfunction continues to exist but that mode is canceled when ECM detects normal condition after that.

entry.ptxt: “A” Camshaft Position - Timing Over-Advanced or System Performance Bank 1
“B” Camshaft Position - Timing Over-Advanced or System Performance Bank 1

item.ptxt: ECM sends that vehicle speed is 0 km/h (0 mile/h) to other control modules.

item.ptxt: ECM limits max. throttle valve opening angle to specified opening angle.
ECM judges that accelerator pedal is released, when brake light switch signal inputted.
ECM selects either TP sensor (main) or (sub), whichever is smaller throttle opening angle.
